project1_title: Weaving Integral Health Care in the Brazilian Amazon
project1_desc: I developing webapps, APIs, and AI solutions for residents in the Lower Amazon and Tapajós regions. The project aims to strengthen Primary Health Care (PHC) using digital and social technologies to reduce inequalities. It is coordinated by Prof. Aylene Bousquat (USP) and funded by
project2_title: Machine Learning for Political Risk Analysis
project2_desc: Research developing a machine learning methodology to evaluate how political instability affects subnational FDI decisions. It integrates economic, institutional, and georeferenced event data to identify local determinants and map priority risk areas. Supported by
project3_desc: Applied econometrics project analyzing trade and geopolitical tensions between China, the United States, and Taiwan (2012–2022). It examines how rising conflicts affect the risk of Chinese offensive action and how China–U.S. economic relations influence cross-strait dynamics. Supported by

profile_p1: I am a Master's student at the University of São Paulo (USP), funded by BNDES and advised by Prof. João Neto. My research focuses on AI, with an emphasis on policy evaluation and machine learning.
profile_p2: I was a research assistant at FEA-USP, supervised by Gilmar Masiero. I hold degrees in International Relations from ESPM-SP and Chemical Engineering from USP. I am currently an AI Engineer at Asibras, and previously worked as CEO of SMTech and as a Data Engineer at China Construction Bank in Beijing.
profile_contact_p: Feel free to email me for any questions or collaboration opportunities: alison.sousa@usp.br.
